newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice ends mostly limit-down on stop-loss.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice ends mostly limit-down on stop-loss.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended mostly limit-down on Wednesday on continued stop-loss selling by retail investors, traders said.
The key September 1996 contract ended limit-down at 2,369 yuan ($285) per tonne, losing 90 yuan. It opened at 2,370 and hit an intra-day high of 2,400.
October rose 30 to 2,480 yuan and December ended limit-down at 2,582. Combined volume rose sharply to 27,600 tonnes from 5,600.
Traders said nervous retail investors continued to liquidate their long positions, resulting in sharp falls.
"The price of rice futures was below the spot price, but retail investors were afraid to hold long positions because they did not want to deliver spot goods," one trader said.
The price of spot rice is around 2,400 yuan per tonne.
Traders expect rice to drop further in the next few days.
